subject: Web3
title: What Is an NFT
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Is an NFT.

hook.text: An NFT is a digital receipt that proves you own something unique on the internet. Think of it as a deed.

buildup.text: NFT stands for 'non-fungible token.' Non-fungible means one of a kind â€” unlike dollars, which are interchangeable.

discovery.text: Each NFT lives on a blockchain with a unique ID. It can't be duplicated, forged, or deleted.

twist.text: Owning an NFT doesn't always mean owning the image. You often own the token, not the copyright.

climax.text: NFTs proved that digital scarcity is possible. For the first time, a file could be provably one of a kind.

punchline.text: A digital receipt made digital ownership possible.

quiz.question: What does 'non-fungible' mean?
options: It is one of a kind and not interchangeable
